etymology.description: semantic: 糸(絲) (sī, "silk") + phonetic: 粟(粟) (sù, "millet") = combining silk and millet -> suggests plainness or simplicity
etymology.interpretation: The character 素 originally depicted plain, undyed silk, suggesting simplicity or purity. The phonetic element 粟(粟) (sù, "millet") supports the sound and also relates to a basic, unadorned life.

examples.chinese: 这条围巾设计得很素(這條圍巾設計得很素)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo wéijīn shèjì de hěn sù.
examples.english: This scarf is designed very simply.

examples.chinese: 他坚持吃素(他堅持吃素)，拒绝肉食(拒絕肉食)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiānchí chī sù, jùjué ròushí.
examples.english: He insists on a vegetarian diet and rejects meat.

examples.chinese: 她向往一种素雅的风格(她嚮往一種素雅的風格)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiàngwǎng yì zhǒng sùyǎ de fēnggé.
examples.english: She aspires to a plain and elegant style.
